title: Ticket #412: condor_config_val -dump -startd
description:
condor_config_val -dump -startd does not in fact consult the startd. It just directly reads the configuration from files and prints the result. At the very least, we should detect the conflicting command-line arguments and tell the user.

This problem is not specific to -startd. The same is true for other daemons.

Man page for condor_config_val -dump option has been updated. It ignores all options, so that is the only man page change needed.

Greg T. will modify the usage info output to also reflect the behavior of the -dump option, which was incorrect.
